title: Grothendieck trace theorem
summary: In functional analysis, the Grothendieck trace theorem is an extension of Lidskii's theorem about the trace and the determinant of a certain class of nuclear operators on Banach spaces, the so-called 2 3 {\displaystyle {\tfrac {2}{3}}} -nuclear operators.[1] The theorem was proven in 1966 by Alexander Grothendieck.[2] Lidskii's theorem does not hold in general for Banach spaces.
